abstract: United States District Court for Western District of Wisconsin rules, 2-1, that state Legislature's redrawing of State Assembly districts in 2011 in favor of Republicans was unconstitutional as it was partisan gerrymander; ruling is first in three decades to strike down gerrymander on partisan grounds; case can now go before Supreme Court, and should higher court affirm ruling it could have profound consequences for redistricting in 2021.

headline.print_headline: Districts Favor G.O.P. Unfairly, Court Finds in a Key State Case
headline.main: Judges Find Wisconsin Redistricting Unfairly Favored Republicans

snippet: A federal panel called the 2011 redrawing of Wisconsin Assembly districts an unconstitutional gerrymander, ruling in a case that could go to the Supreme Court....
lead_paragraph: A federal panel called the 2011 redrawing of Wisconsin Assembly districts an unconstitutional gerrymander, ruling in a case that could go to the Supreme Court.
